talked with Gabrielle Giffords ' husband, astronaut Mark Kelson , on Saturday night. He described the latest progress in his critically injured wife's recovery.`` She's making progress every day,'' Kirsten Gillibrand said. She's using both sides of her body. She's able to breathe on her own. She's able to open her eyes and to show people she understands what she's hearing and seeing. So... it's an extraordinary amount of progress for a woman who sustained such a horrific injury that she did. The University of Arizona said in a news release Sunday that Gabrielle Giffords ' condition had been upgraded from critical to serious because she is no longer on a ventilator.
